text.__SUMMARY__: Penicillium striatisporum is an anamorph species of fungus in the genus Penicillium which was isolated from the rhizosphere of chilli peppers.Penicillium striatisporum has an selective antifungal activity against Candida albicans This species produces striatisporin A, striatisporolide A, versiol, calbistrin C, deformylcalbistrin A, citromycetin, citromycin, fulvic acid, (-)-2,3-dihydrocitromycetin and (+)-hexylitaconic acid
text.Further reading:
Stewart, M; Capon, R. J.; Lacey, E; Tennant, S; Gill, J. H. (2005). "Calbistrin E and two other new metabolites from an Australian isolate of Penicillium striatisporum". Journal of Natural Products. 68 (4): 581–4. doi:10.1021/np049614y. PMID 15844954.
Stolk, Amelia C. (1969). "Four new species of Penicillium". Antonie van Leeuwenhoek. 35 (3): 261–74. doi:10.1007/BF02219148. PMID 5309903.
Ma, Yan; Chang, Zhi-Zhou; Zhao, Jiang-tao; Zhou, Ming-guo (2008). "Antifungal activity of Penicillium striatisporum Pst10 and its biocontrol effect on Phytophthora root rot of chilli pepper". Biological Control. 44: 24. doi:10.1016/j.biocontrol.2007.10.005.
Robert Samson (2013). Advances in Penicillium and Aspergillus Systematics. Springer Science & Business Media. ISBN 1-4757-1856-X.
John W. Blunt, Murray H. G. Munro (2013). Dictionary of Marine Natural Products. CRC Press. ISBN 0-8493-8217-3.
